Detailed Description

AuthGatewayBean is a Java Bean that allows the developer to create, query or end a generic authentication session without making direct HTTP calls.

Author:
Kenneth Sharp
Version:
3.0 (released September 15, 2005)

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

This is the Bean constructor.

Ends the current session by calling the EndSession applet.

void edu.stanford.slac.ssrl.authentication.utility.AuthGatewayBean.initialize (  String  appName,
String  userid,
String  password,
String  authMethod,
int  sessionTimeout
) 
 

Initialize the bean with a new session.

This version of initialize looks for the servlet host in the java system property "authgateway.host".

Parameters:
String appName is the application instantiating this bean.
String userid is the clear text user id
String password is the clear text password for the user.
String authMethod is the authentication method to use (null for default)
int sessionTimeout is the number of seconds a session remains inactive before invalidation (-1 for default)

void edu.stanford.slac.ssrl.authentication.utility.AuthGatewayBean.initialize (  String  appName,
String  userid,
String  password,
String  authMethod,
String  servletHost
) 
 

Initialize the bean with a new session.

This version of initialize uses the default inactive session timeout.

Parameters:
String appName is the application instantiating this bean.
String userid is the clear text user id
String password is the clear text password for the user.
String authMethod is the authentication method to use (null for default)
String servletHost is such as http://smb.slac.stanford.edu where authentication is running.

void edu.stanford.slac.ssrl.authentication.utility.AuthGatewayBean.initialize (  String  appName,
String  userid,
String  password,
String  authMethod
) 
 

Initialize the bean with a new session.

This version of initialize looks for the servlet host in the java system property authgateway.host and uses the default inactive session timeout.

Parameters:
String appName is the application instantiating this bean.
String userid is the clear text user id
String password is the clear text password for the user.
String authMethod is the authentication method to use (null for default)

void edu.stanford.slac.ssrl.authentication.utility.AuthGatewayBean.initialize (  String  appName,
String  userid,
String  password,
String  authMethod,
String  servletHost,
int  sessionTimeout
) 
 

Initialize the bean with a new session.

Parameters:
String appName is the application instantiating this bean.
String userid is the clear text user id
String password is the clear text password for the user.
String authMethod is the authentication method to use (null for default)
String servletHost is such as http://smb.slac.stanford.edu where authentication is running.
int sessionTimeout is the number of seconds a session remains inactive before invalidation (-1 for default)

void edu.stanford.slac.ssrl.authentication.utility.AuthGatewayBean.initialize (  String  SessionID,
String  appName
) 
 

Initialize the bean with an existing session id, and application name

ServletHost, (http://smb.slac.stanford.edu for example), is found as a Java system property authgateway.host which must be set when Java starts the application

Parameters:
String SessionID is the existing session's id
String appName is the application instantiating this bean.

void edu.stanford.slac.ssrl.authentication.utility.AuthGatewayBean.initialize (  String  SessionID,
String  appName,
String  servletHost
) 
 

Initialize the bean with an existing session id, application name, and servlet host

Parameters:
String SessionID is the existing session's id
String appName is the application instantiating this bean.
String servletHost is the scheme://hostname:port where authentication is running.

boolean edu.stanford.slac.ssrl.authentication.utility.AuthGatewayBean.isSessionValid (   ) 
 

Returns:
true if session is valid, false otherwise.

boolean edu.stanford.slac.ssrl.authentication.utility.AuthGatewayBean.isUpdateSuccessful (   ) 
 

Returns:
boolean set to True if the last update was successful; False otherwise

boolean edu.stanford.slac.ssrl.authentication.utility.AuthGatewayBean.updateSessionData (  boolean  recheckDatabase  ) 
 

Updates the session data by calling the SessionStatus servlet. Also rechecks the database for beamline access if the recheckDatabase parameter is true.

Parameters:
boolean recheckDatabase forces a recheck of beamline access if true.
Returns:
true if the update is performed successfully. returns false</otherwise>.
